result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noah-Shilo Jacob Moran

records.addlTxt:
9:41 AM Defendant Noah Shilo Jacob Moran in court.  Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell in court for Noah Shilo Jacob Moran.  Attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  Atty Campbell states they are resolved and files plea paperwork.  State states the joint recommendations.  Atty Campbell is in agreement.  Court questions DE on the plea agreement.  DE pleads NC.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds DE guilty.  State notes there is no further victim information and no request for restitution and makes statement re: the joint recommendations.  Atty Campbell makes statement on behalf of the DE.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  DE to report to P&P before close of business today.

22CM359 - Ct 1:  NC $543.00 - Ct 2:  NC  $443.00 - 2 days credit if probation would be revoked
22CM130 - Ct 1:  NC $543.00 - 6 days credit if probation would be revoked
22CM426 is dismissed/read-in 

Probation for 18 months on each count concurrent to each other
$543.00 on 22CM130 and 22CM359 and $443.00 on 22CM359 - to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA samples to be provided
Conditions of probation:
Absolute sobriety
No use/possession of any controlled substances or alcohol w/o valid prescription
No bars/taverns/liquor stores or place whose primary purpose is the sale/consumption of alcohol
AODA and follow up
Anger management and follow up 
Any other counseling/treatment per agent 

***All remaining counts dismissed/read-in***
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Absolute sobriety at all times. Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.

2:29 PM Defendant Noah-Shilo Jacob Moran in court, in custody from LEC w/atty. Hayes.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE does qualify for PD representation.  State requests cash bond as Courts discretion. Atty. Hayes makes bail argument for signature bond.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date. $500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute sobriety at all times. No possession of alcohol.  Not to go to bars/taverns/liquor stores or any business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.
Return date scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
